intro: Chondrophylla fremontii, commonly known as Fremont's chondrophylla, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and grayish-green, while its flowers are small and yellowish, often appearing in clusters. Chondrophylla fremontii plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is of interest to botanists studying desert flora.
